description: From tradere, traditum (“to transmit, give up”). Compare French traditif.

adjectives.description: traditive (comparative more traditive, superlative most traditive)

entries.meaning: Transmitted or transmissible from parent to child, or from older to younger, by oral communication; traditional.
examples: it is said there are traditive interprétations , as well as traditive propositions , but these have not much distinct consideration in them
